markdown: <::logo: Intra-Science Research Foundation / Biomedical Perspectives INTRA-SCIENCE RESEARCH FOUNDATION BIOMEDICAL PERSPECTIVES VOLUME 3, Number 3 Fall 1976 A circular logo features two nested rectangular shapes, with the foundation's name encircling it.::> <::attestation: RECEIVED stamp Status: Received Readable Text: DEC 1 4 1976 Short description: Angled stamp on the top left corner.::> VICE CHANCELLOR ACADEMIC AFFAIRS 12:30 THE 1976 LOUIS PASTEUR HUMANITARIAN AWARD <::A black and white photograph showing two men in tuxedos. The man on the left, Milton Golden, is presenting an award (a plaque or framed item) to the man on the right, Henry H. Reichhold. Both men are smiling and shaking hands. : figure::> Milton Golden presenting the Award to Henry H. Reichhold <::A black and white photograph showing two men in tuxedos. The man on the left, Maurice Samson, is looking towards the man on the right, Henry Reichhold. Henry Reichhold is holding a small object in his hands and appears to be speaking or reminiscing. : figure::> Maurice Samson and Henry Reichhold reminiscing about their long business association The 1976 Louis Pasteur Humanitarian Award was presented to Henry H. Reichhold on October 16, 1976, at the Century Plaza Hotel in Los Angeles. The Foundation presented this award in recognition of the pioneering technological achievements and outstanding leadership in the chemical and coatings industry demonstrated by Henry Reichhold, the Founder and current Chief Executive Officer of Reichhold Chemicals, Incorporated. Louis Pasteur believed in a very important relationship of research and progress: "There are sciences and applications of science linked together as fruit is linked to the tree that has borne it." Henry Reichhold has focused on the philosophy that "the key to growth is research," particularly research directed toward new products and new application. It is thus that Henry Reichhold has made a vital contribution to progress - for the industry and for the public. The Foundation salutes this unique understanding and im- plementation of the role of science and technology in the life of the community. *A Bulletin of the Intra-Science Research Foundation, P.O. Box 18589, Los Angeles, CA 90018. Telephone: (213) 749-5516. Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/jjyx0226

chunks.markdown: <::logo: Intra-Science Research Foundation / Biomedical Perspectives INTRA-SCIENCE RESEARCH FOUNDATION BIOMEDICAL PERSPECTIVES VOLUME 3, Number 3 Fall 1976 A circular logo features two nested rectangular shapes, with the foundation's name encircling it.::>

<::attestation: RECEIVED stamp Status: Received Readable Text: DEC 1 4 1976 Short description: Angled stamp on the top left corner.::> VICE CHANCELLOR ACADEMIC AFFAIRS 12:30 THE 1976 LOUIS PASTEUR HUMANITARIAN AWARD

<::A black and white photograph showing two men in tuxedos. The man on the left, Milton Golden, is presenting an award (a plaque or framed item) to the man on the right, Henry H. Reichhold. Both men are smiling and shaking hands. : figure::> Milton Golden presenting the Award to Henry H. Reichhold <::A black and white photograph showing two men in tuxedos. The man on the left, Maurice Samson, is looking towards the man on the right, Henry Reichhold. Henry Reichhold is holding a small object in his hands and appears to be speaking or reminiscing. : figure::> Maurice Samson and Henry Reichhold reminiscing about their long business association

The 1976 Louis Pasteur Humanitarian Award was presented to Henry H. Reichhold on October 16, 1976, at the Century Plaza Hotel in Los Angeles. The Foundation presented this award in recognition of the pioneering technological achievements and outstanding leadership in the chemical and coatings industry demonstrated by Henry Reichhold, the Founder and current Chief Executive Officer of Reichhold Chemicals, Incorporated.
Louis Pasteur believed in a very important relationship of

research and progress: "There are sciences and applications of science linked together as fruit is linked to the tree that has borne it." Henry Reichhold has focused on the philosophy that "the key to growth is research," particularly research directed toward new products and new application. It is thus that Henry Reichhold has made a vital contribution to progress - for the industry and for the public.
The Foundation salutes this unique understanding and im- plementation of the role of science and technology in the life of the community.
*A Bulletin of the Intra-Science Research Foundation, P.O. Box 18589, Los Angeles, CA 90018. Telephone: (213) 749-5516. Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/jjyx0226
